Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately illustrate a string telephone connecting two students, clearly depicting the string as the medium for sound transmission.
The student can show the two students standing far apart with the string telephone visibly allowing sound to travel between them.
The student can include detailed labels or symbols, such as sound waves, to indicate that the string is used to communicate sound, not light.
The student can accurately depict and label the materials used, such as cups at either end of the string, emphasizing the use of these materials in building the device.
The student can effectively represent the function of the communication device, showing how it facilitates the conveying of messages over a distance.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to misunderstand basic concepts such as sound waves traveling through the string, but they might occasionally omit minor details in the labeling of their diagram (e.g., forgetting to label one of the cups).
Minor infrequent gaps might include slightly unclear depictions of the start and end points of the sound communication, though this is rare and usually corrected.
